org.settings4j.connector

Class JNDIConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.settings4j.connector.AbstractConnector
      • org.settings4j.connector.JNDIConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connector

    public class JNDIConnector
extends AbstractConnector
    The JNDI Context implementation of an Connector.

    Normal Use

    This JNDI connector is used in the default settings4j-config: 

     <connector name="JNDIConnector"
     class="org.settings4j.connector.JNDIConnector">
     <contentResolver-ref ref="DefaultContentResolver" />
     <objectResolver-ref ref="DefaultObjectResolver" />
 </connector>
    During the first use it will check if JNDI is accessible. If no JNDI context exists, The connector will deactivate itself. A INFO-Log message will print this information.

    The default contextPathPrefix is "java:comp/env/". This JNDI Connector will first check if a value for "contextPathPrefix + key" exists and second if a value for the "key" only exists.

    Custom Use

    You can also configure the JNDI Connector to connect to another JNDI Context as the default one. 

     <connector name="JNDIConnector"
     class="org.settings4j.connector.JNDIConnector">
     <param name="initialContextFactory" value="org.apache.naming.java.javaURLContextFactory"/>
     <param name="providerUrl" value="localhost:1099"/>
     <param name="urlPkgPrefixes" value="org.apache.naming"/>
 </connector>
    All three parameters must be set "initialContextFactory", "providerUrl", "urlPkgPrefixes" if you want use another JNDI Context.

    getString(), getContent(), getObject()

    getString()

    If the getString() JNDI lookup returns an Object which isn't a String, a WARN-Log message will be printed.

    getContent()

    If the getContent() JNDI lookup returns a String it will try to get a byte-Array Content from the ContentResolvers (assuming the String is as FileSystemPath or ClassPath).
    Else if the getContent() JNDI lookup returns an Object which isn't a byte[], a WARN-Log message will be printed.

    getObject()

    If the getObject() JNDI lookup returns a String it will try to get an Object from the ObjectResolvers (assuming the String is as FileSystemPath or ClassPath which can be resolved to an Object).

    Author:
    Harald.Brabenetz

    • Method Detail

      • getContent

        public byte[] getContent(String key)
        return a byte[]-Value for the given key.

        The concrete implementation can use the ContentResolver if required

        Parameters:
        key - the Key for the configuration-property. e.g.: "com/mycompany/myapp/myParameterKey"
        Returns:
        the byte[]-Value for the given key

      • getObject

        public Object getObject(String key)
        return a Object-Value for the given key.

        The concrete implementation can use the ObjectResolver if required

        Parameters:
        key - the Key for the configuration-property. e.g.: "com/mycompany/myapp/myParameterKey"
        Returns:
        the Object-Value for the given key, or null if no value where found.

      • getString

        public String getString(String key)
        return a String-Value for the given key.
        Parameters:
        key - the Key for the configuration-property. e.g.: "com/mycompany/myapp/myParameterKey"
        Returns:
        the String-Value for the given key

      • setObject

        public int setObject(String key,
                     Object value)
        Set or replace a new Value for the given key.
        If set or replace a value is not possible because of a readonly JNDI-Context, then Constants.SETTING_NOT_POSSIBLE must be returned. If set or replace was successful, then Constants.SETTING_SUCCESS must be returned.
        Parameters:
        key - the Key for the configuration-property (will not be normalized: add contextPathPrefix, replace '\' with '/'). e.g.: "com\mycompany\myapp\myParameterKey" => "java:comp/env/com/mycompany/myapp/myParameterKey"
        value - the new Object-Value for the given key
        Returns:
        Returns Constants.SETTING_SUCCESS or Constants.SETTING_NOT_POSSIBLE

      • isJNDIAvailable

        public boolean isJNDIAvailable()
        check if a JNDI context is available and sets the internal Flag setIsJNDIAvailable(Boolean).

        If the internal Flag IsJNDIAvailable is False this Connector is disabled.

        Returns:
        true if a JNDI Context could be initialized.

      • setProviderUrl

        public void setProviderUrl(String providerUrl)

      • rebindToContext

        public int rebindToContext(String key,
                           Object value)
        Parameters:
        key - the JNDI-Key (will NOT be normalized).
        value - the JNDI-Value.
        Returns:
        Constants.SETTING_NOT_POSSIBLE if the JNDI Context ist readonly.
